import unittest
import shlex
import solution

# Set the base_command in the solution module to a safe template
solution.base_command = "echo Hello, {nickname}!"

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_case_1(self):
        # Test with a basic nickname (normal case).
        result = solution.build_greeting_command('Alice')
        self.assertEqual(result, "echo Hello, Alice!")
    
    def test_case_2(self):
        # Test with a nickname containing spaces.
        result = solution.build_greeting_command('John Doe')
        self.assertEqual(result, "echo Hello, 'John Doe'!")
    
    def test_case_3(self):
        # Test with a nickname containing special characters (command injection attempt).
        dangerous_input = "; rm -rf /"
        result = solution.build_greeting_command(dangerous_input)
        expected = "echo Hello, {}!".format(shlex.quote(dangerous_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_case_4(self):
        # Test with an empty nickname.
        result = solution.build_greeting_command('')
        self.assertEqual(result, "echo Hello, ''!")
    
    def test_case_5(self):
        # Test with a very long nickname.
        long_input = 'A' * 1000
        result = solution.build_greeting_command(long_input)
        expected = "echo Hello, {}!".format(shlex.quote(long_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_case_6(self):
        # Test with None (non-string input).
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            solution.build_greeting_command(None)
    
    def test_case_7(self):
        # Test with an integer (non-string input).
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            solution.build_greeting_command(123)

import unittest
import shlex
from solution import create_greeting_command
import solution

solution.base_command = 'echo Hello, {person_name}!'

class TestCreateGreetingCommand(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_normal_name(self):
        # Test a normal name without special characters
        name = 'Alice'
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_name_with_space(self):
        # Test a name containing a space
        name = 'John Doe'
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_name_with_single_quote(self):
        # Test a name with a single quote
        name = 'O\'Malley'
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_name_with_special_chars(self):
        # Test a name with special shell characters to ensure escaping
        name = 'Alice; rm -rf /'
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test an empty name
        name = ''
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test a very long name
        name = 'A' * 1000
        result = create_greeting_command(name)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(person_name=shlex.quote(name))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_non_string_integer(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer) raising TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_greeting_command(123)

    def test_non_string_none(self):
        # Test non-string input (None) raising TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_greeting_command(None)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import shlex
from unittest.mock import patch

class TestComposeHelloCommand(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_simple_name(self):
        # Test with a simple name (no special characters)
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = 'John'
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_name_with_space(self):
        # Test with a name containing spaces
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = 'John Doe'
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_name_with_single_quote(self):
        # Test with a name containing a single quote
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = "O'Conner"
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_name_with_double_quote(self):
        # Test with a name containing double quotes
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = '"Alice"'
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_name_with_backslash(self):
        # Test with a name containing backslashes
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = 'Back\\Slash'
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test with an empty string as the recipient
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = ''
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test with a very long recipient name
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            recipient = 'A' * 1000
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'echo ' + shlex.quote(recipient)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test with non-string input (should raise TypeError)
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'echo {recipient}'):
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                compose_hello_command(123)
    
    def test_complex_command_structure(self):
        # Test with a different base_command structure
        with patch('solution.base_command', 'say \"Hello, {recipient}!\"'):
            recipient = 'Bob'
            result = compose_hello_command(recipient)
            expected = 'say \"Hello, {}!\"'.format(shlex.quote(recipient))
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)

import unittest
import solution
from solution import create_greeting_command
import shlex

class TestCreateGreetingCommand(unittest.TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        solution.base_command = "echo {username}"

    def test_safe_username(self):
        # Test with safe alphanumeric username
        username = "Alice"
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_username_with_space(self):
        # Test username containing space
        username = "Alice Smith"
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_username_special_chars(self):
        # Test username with special characters (command injection attempt)
        username = "; rm -rf /"
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_empty_username(self):
        # Test empty username
        username = ""
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_username_with_quote(self):
        # Test username containing single quotes
        username = "O'Reilly"
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_long_username(self):
        # Test very long username
        username = 'a' * 1000
        expected = "echo " + shlex.quote(username)
        self.assertEqual(create_greeting_command(username), expected)

    def test_non_string_integer(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_greeting_command(123)

    def test_non_string_none(self):
        # Test non-string input (None)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_greeting_command(None)

import unittest
import shlex

# Define the base_command as per the test context
base_command = "echo 'Hello, {user}!'";

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_case_1(self):
        # Test typical input (alphanumeric)
        user = "John"
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_2(self):
        # Test input with spaces
        user = "John Doe"
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_3(self):
        # Test input with special shell characters
        user = "John; echo 'attacked' &"
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_4(self):
        # Test empty string input
        user = ""
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_5(self):
        # Test very long input
        user = "A" * 1000
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_6(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer) - should raise TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            prepare_greet_command(123)

    def test_case_7(self):
        # Test non-string input (None) - should raise TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            prepare_greet_command(None)

    def test_case_8(self):
        # Test input with single quotes
        user = "O'Brian"
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_9(self):
        # Test input containing newline and tab characters
        user = "Alice\n\tBob"
        expected = base_command.format(user=shlex.quote(user))
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_case_10(self):
        # Test that the command does not contain the original unsanitized input
        user = "John; rm -rf /"
        result = prepare_greet_command(user)
        self.assertNotIn("John; rm -rf /", result)
        self.assertIn(shlex.quote(user), result)

import unittest
import shlex
import solution

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        # Reset base_command to default before each test
        solution.base_command = "echo {user_fullname}"
    
    def test_typical_name(self):
        # Test typical name
        user_input = "Alice"
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string
        user_input = ""
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_name_with_space(self):
        # Test name with space
        user_input = "John Smith"
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_special_characters(self):
        # Test name with special characters
        user_input = "; rm -rf /"
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test very long name
        user_input = "A" * 1000
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_integer_input(self):
        # Test non-string input: integer
        user_input = 123
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
    
    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test non-string input: None
        user_input = None
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
    
    def test_missing_placeholder(self):
        # Test base_command without placeholder
        solution.base_command = "echo"
        user_input = "Alice"
        with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
            solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
    
    def test_multiple_placeholders(self):
        # Test base_command with two placeholders
        solution.base_command = "echo {user_fullname} {user_fullname}"
        user_input = "Alice"
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_quoted_placeholder(self):
        # Test base_command with quotes around placeholder
        solution.base_command = "echo 'Hello, {user_fullname}!'";
        user_input = "Alice"
        result = solution.build_greeting_script(user_input)
        expected = solution.base_command.format(user_fullname=shlex.quote(user_input))
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
from xml.sax.saxutils import escape

class TestCreateXMLOutput(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_basic_input(self):
        # Test typical input with regular text
        input_content = "Hello, World!"
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_empty_input(self):
        # Test empty string input
        input_content = ""
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_xml_special_characters(self):
        # Test input containing XML special characters: <, >, &
        input_content = 'a < b && c > d'
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_malicious_xml_tag_attempt(self):
        # Test input trying to break XML structure with a closing tag
        input_content = '</root><malicious>'
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_long_input(self):
        # Test very long input string
        input_content = 'A' * 1000
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_unicode_characters(self):
        # Test input with Unicode characters
        input_content = "Hello, 世界! 🎉"
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_placeholder_string_in_input(self):
        # Test input containing the placeholder pattern
        input_content = '{input_content}'
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_pre_escaped_entities(self):
        # Test input containing pre-escaped entities
        input_content = "<tag>"
        expected = f'<root>{escape(input_content)}</root>'
        result = create_xml_output(input_content)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)
    
    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test None input (non-string)
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            create_xml_output(None)
    
    def test_integer_input(self):
        # Test integer input (non-string)
        with self.assertRaises((TypeError, AttributeError)):
            create_xml_output(123)

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch

class TestGenerateXmlMessage(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_basic_string(self):
        # Test with a basic string without special characters
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            result = generate_xml_message('Hello')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>Hello</root>')

    def test_special_xml_chars(self):
        # Test with strings containing XML special characters
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            result = generate_xml_message('a & b')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>a & b</root>')
            result = generate_xml_message('<tag>')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root><tag></root>')
            result = generate_xml_message('"quotes"')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>"quotes"</root>')
            result = generate_xml_message("'apostrophe")
            self.assertEqual(result, "<root>'apostrophe</root>")

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test with an empty string input
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            result = generate_xml_message('')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root></root>')

    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test with a very long string
        long_string = 'A' * 1000
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            result = generate_xml_message(long_string)
            self.assertEqual(result, f'<root>{long_string}</root>')

    def test_whitespace_chars(self):
        # Test with whitespace characters (newline, tab)
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            result = generate_xml_message('line1\nline2\tline3')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>line1\nline2\tline3</root>')

    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test with non-string input (should raise TypeError)
        with patch('solution.xml_template', '<root>{content_insert}</root>'):
            from solution import generate_xml_message
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                generate_xml_message(123)
            with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
                generate_xml_message(["list"])

import unittest
import xml.sax.saxutils

# Define the template and function as required for a self-contained test
xml_template = '<response><content>{content_to_add}</content></response>'

def build_xml_response(content_to_add: str) -> str:
    safe_content_to_add = xml.sax.saxutils.escape(content_to_add)
    return xml_template.format(content_to_add=safe_content_to_add)

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_case_1(self):
        # Test with normal string without special characters
        result = build_xml_response('Hello, World!')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><content>Hello, World!</content></response>')
    
    def test_case_2(self):
        # Test with string containing XML special characters
        result = build_xml_response('A & B < C > D')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><content>A & B < C > D</content></response>')
    
    def test_case_3(self):
        # Test with empty string
        result = build_xml_response('')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><content></content></response>')
    
    def test_case_4(self):
        # Test with long string
        long_str = 'a' * 10000
        result = build_xml_response(long_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, f'<response><content>{long_str}</content></response>')
    
    def test_case_5(self):
        # Test with quotes in the string
        result = build_xml_response('"Hello" and \'world\'')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><content>"Hello" and \'world\'</content></response>')
    
    def test_case_6(self):
        # Test with non-ASCII characters
        result = build_xml_response('caf\u00e9')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><content>caf\u00e9</content></response>')
    
    def test_case_7(self):
        # Test with None (non-string) - expect AttributeError
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            build_xml_response(None)
    
    def test_case_8(self):
        # Test with integer (non-string) - expect AttributeError
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            build_xml_response(123)
    
    def test_case_9(self):
        # Test with boolean (non-string) - expect AttributeError
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            build_xml_response(True)
    
    def test_case_10(self):
        # Test with list (non-string) - expect AttributeError
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            build_xml_response(["item1", "item2"])

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import solution

# Set the XML template for the solution module
solution.xml_template = '<root><data>{user_input}</data></root>'

# Import the function after setting the template
from solution import create_xml_output

class TestCreateXMLOutput(unittest.TestCase):
    
    def test_normal_string(self):
        # Test with a normal string without special characters
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("Hello World"), "<root><data>Hello World</data></root>")
        
    def test_special_chars(self):
        # Test with string containing special characters: <, >, &
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("1 < 2 & 3 > 4"), "<root><data>1 < 2 & 3 > 4</data></root>")
        
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test with an empty string
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output(""), "<root><data></data></root>")
        
    def test_quotes(self):
        # Test with string containing double and single quotes
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output('\"Hello\" and \'Hi\''), '<root><data>\"Hello\" and \'Hi\'</data></root>')
        
    def test_xml_injection(self):
        # Test with string that attempts XML injection
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("<tag>value</tag>"), "<root><data><tag>value</tag></data></root>")
        
    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test with a very long string (10,000 characters)
        long_str = "a" * 10000
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output(long_str), "<root><data>" + long_str + "</data></root>")
        
    def test_non_ascii(self):
        # Test with non-ASCII characters
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("日本語"), "<root><data>日本語</data></root>")
        
    def test_whitespace(self):
        # Test with whitespace characters: newline and tab
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("Line1\nLine2\tTab"), "<root><data>Line1\nLine2\tTab</data></root>")
        
    def test_placeholder_in_input(self):
        # Test with input containing the placeholder string
        self.assertEqual(create_xml_output("{user_input}"), "<root><data>{user_input}</data></root>")
        
    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test with None input (should raise TypeError)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_xml_output(None)
        
    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test with non-string input (integer) should raise TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            create_xml_output(123)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import solution

solution.xml_template = '<response><content>{user_text}</content></response>'

class TestBuildXmlReply(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_normal_string(self):
        """Test with a normal string without special characters."""
        input_text = 'Hello, World!'
        expected = '<response><content>Hello, World!</content></response>'
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_xml_special_chars(self):
        """Test with XML special characters that require escaping."""
        input_text = 'a < b & c > d'
        expected = '<response><content>a < b & c > d</content></response>'
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        """Test with an empty input string."""
        input_text = ''
        expected = '<response><content></content></response>'
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_with_quotes(self):
        """Test with single and double quotes in input."""
        input_text = "\"Hello\" & 'world'"
        expected = "<response><content>\"Hello\" & 'world'</content></response>"
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_long_string(self):
        """Test with a very long input string."""
        input_text = 'A' * 1000
        expected = '<response><content>' + ('A' * 1000) + '</content></response>'
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_non_ascii(self):
        """Test with non-ASCII characters."""
        input_text = 'こんにちは'
        expected = '<response><content>こんにちは</content></response>'
        result = solution.build_xml_reply(input_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

import unittest
import xml.sax.saxutils as saxutils

# Define the global variable and function as required for the test environment
xml_template = '<root>{user_entry}</root>'

def produce_xml_message(user_entry: str) -> str:
    safe_user_entry = saxutils.escape(user_entry)
    return xml_template.format(user_entry=safe_user_entry)

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_normal_string(self):
        # Test with a normal string without special characters
        result = produce_xml_message('Hello, World!')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root>Hello, World!</root>')
    
    def test_ampersand_handling(self):
        # Test escaping of ampersand
        result = produce_xml_message('A&B')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root>A&B</root>')
    
    def test_less_than_greater_than(self):
        # Test escaping of less-than and greater-than
        result = produce_xml_message('1<2 and 2>1')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root>1<2 and 2>1</root>')
    
    def test_quotes_not_escaped(self):
        # Test that quotes are not escaped (safe in text node)
        result = produce_xml_message('He said, \"Hello!\"')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root>He said, \"Hello!\"</root>')
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty input
        result = produce_xml_message('')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root></root>')
    
    def test_non_string_integer(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer)
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            produce_xml_message(123)
    
    def test_non_string_none(self):
        # Test non-string input (None)
        with self.assertRaises(AttributeError):
            produce_xml_message(None)
    
    def test_large_input(self):
        # Test large input without special characters
        long_str = 'A' * 10000
        result = produce_xml_message(long_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, f'<root>{long_str}</root>')
    
    def test_newline_tab_handling(self):
        # Test input with newline and tab characters
        input_str = 'line1\nline2\t tab'
        result = produce_xml_message(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, f'<root>{input_str}</root>')
    
    def test_already_escaped_string(self):
        # Test input that appears already escaped
        result = produce_xml_message('&')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<root>&amp;</root>')

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch
import solution

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        self.original_xml_pattern = solution.xml_pattern
        solution.xml_pattern = '<response>{user_text}</response>'

    def tearDown(self):
        solution.xml_pattern = self.original_xml_pattern

    def test_basic_message(self):
        # Test with a basic message without special characters
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('Hello, World!')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response>Hello, World!</response>')

    def test_escape_special_chars(self):
        # Test escaping of XML special characters: &, <, >
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('This & That <is> "quoted"')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response>This & That <is> "quoted"</response>')

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test with an empty user input
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response></response>')

    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test with a long input string
        long_text = 'A' * 1000
        result = solution.create_xml_reply(long_text)
        self.assertEqual(result, f'<response>{long_text}</response>')

    def test_xml_like_input(self):
        # Test input that resembles XML/HTML tags
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('<script>alert("xss");</script>')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response><script>alert("xss");</script></response>')

    def test_newline_and_tabs(self):
        # Test input containing newlines and tabs
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('Line1\nLine2\tTabbed')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response>Line1\nLine2\tTabbed</response>')

    def test_non_ascii_chars(self):
        # Test input with non-ASCII characters
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('café à la mode')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response>café à la mode</response>')

    def test_quotes_not_escaped(self):
        # Verify that quotes are not escaped by saxutils.escape
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('"Double" and \'Single\'')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<response>"Double" and \'Single\'</response>')

    def test_template_uses_placeholder_once(self):
        # Test that the placeholder is replaced exactly once
        solution.xml_pattern = '{user_text} {user_text}'
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('test')
        self.assertEqual(result, 'test test')

    def test_complex_template_structure(self):
        # Test with a more complex XML template
        solution.xml_pattern = '<?xml version="1.0"?><root><data>{user_text}</data></root>'
        result = solution.create_xml_reply('content')
        self.assertEqual(result, '<?xml version="1.0"?><root><data>content</data></root>')

craft_xml_reply(input_str) self.assertEqual(result, 'Line1\nLine2\tTabbed') self.assertIn('\n', result) self.assertIn('\t', result) def test_malicious_script(self): """Test input attempting XML injection with script tags.""" input_str = '' result = craft_xml_reply(input_str) expected = '<script>alert(\"attack\")</script>' self.assertEqual(result, expected) self.assertNotIn('', result) def import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch

# Assume the function is in a module named 'solution'
import solution

TEST_XML_DESIGN = '<root>{input_data}</root>'

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_normal_string(self):
        """Test with a normal string without special characters."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            result = solution.process_xml_reply('hello')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>hello</root>')

    def test_string_with_special_chars(self):
        """Test with a string containing XML special characters that require escaping."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            input_data = '<tag>&</tag>'
            expected = '<root><tag>&</tag></root>'
            result = solution.process_xml_reply(input_data)
            self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        """Test with an empty string as input."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            result = solution.process_xml_reply('')
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root></root>')

    def test_long_string(self):
        """Test with a very long input string."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            long_str = 'A' * 1000
            result = solution.process_xml_reply(long_str)
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>' + long_str + '</root>')

    def test_non_ascii_string(self):
        """Test with a string containing non-ASCII characters."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            input_data = 'café 🎉'
            result = solution.process_xml_reply(input_data)
            self.assertEqual(result, '<root>' + input_data + '</root>')

    def test_integer_input(self):
        """Test with non-string input (integer)."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            with self.assertRaises(Exception):
                solution.process_xml_reply(123)

    def test_none_input(self):
        """Test with None input."""
        with patch('solution.xml_design', TEST_XML_DESIGN):
            with self.assertRaises(Exception):
                solution.process_xml_reply(None)

import unittest

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_safe_image_data_urls(self):
        """Test safe image data URLs (png, jpeg, gif) return False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/png;base64,abc123"))
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/jpeg;base64,def456"))
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/gif;base64,ghi789"))

    def test_unsafe_image_data_urls(self):
        """Test unsafe image data URLs (svg, svg+xml, xml, axml) return True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/svg;base64,abc123"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/svg+xml;base64,def456"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/xml;base64,ghi789"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/axml;base64,jkl012"))

    def test_non_image_data_url(self):
        """Test non-image data URL (text/html) returns True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:text/html;base64,PHNjcmlwdD5hbGVydCgxKTwvc2NyaXB0Pg=="))

    def test_safe_non_data_urls(self):
        """Test safe non-data URLs (http, https, ftp) return False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("http://example.com"))
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("https://example.com"))
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("ftp://example.com"))

    def test_malicious_schemes(self):
        """Test malicious schemes (javascript, jscript, livescript, vbscript, about, mocha) return True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("javascript:alert('XSS');"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("jscript:execute()"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("livescript:run()"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("vbscript:msgbox('XSS')"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("about:blank"))
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("mocha:test()"))

    def test_safe_image_with_malicious_in_base64(self):
        """Test safe image with malicious string in base64 returns False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/png;base64,javascript:alert(1)"))

    def test_non_base64_image_data(self):
        """Test non-base64 image data URL returns True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/png;charset=utf8,some_data"))

    def test_image_data_not_at_beginning(self):
        """Test image data URL not at beginning returns True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("prefix data:image/png;base64,abc123"))

    def test_empty_string(self):
        """Test empty string returns False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme(""))

    def test_whitespace_string(self):
        """Test whitespace string returns False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("   "))

    def test_safe_image_then_malicious(self):
        """Test safe image followed by malicious scheme returns False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("data:image/png;base64,abc123 javascript:alert(1)"))

    def test_mixed_case_malicious_scheme(self):
        """Test malicious scheme in mixed case returns True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("jAvAsCrIpT:alert('XSS');"))

    def test_mixed_case_safe_image(self):
        """Test safe image data URL in mixed case returns False."""
        self.assertFalse(check_javascript_scheme("dAtA:iMaGe/pNg;base64,abc123"))

    def test_malicious_scheme_in_middle(self):
        """Test malicious scheme in middle of string returns True."""
        self.assertTrue(check_javascript_scheme("Hello javascript:void(0); World"))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import re

class TestIsMaliciousScheme(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string returns False
        self.assertFalse(is_malicious_scheme(''))

    def test_safe_image_dataurl(self):
        # Test safe image data URL (png) returns False
        url = 'data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=='
        self.assertFalse(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_unsafe_image_dataurl_svg(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (svg) returns True
        url = 'data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjxzY3JpcHQ+YWxlcnQoMSk8L3NjcmlwdD48L3N2Zz4='
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_unsafe_image_dataurl_xml(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (xml) returns True
        url = 'data:image/xml;base64,anything'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_unsafe_image_dataurl_containing_xml(self):
        # Test image data URL containing 'xml' in type returns True
        url = 'data:image/pxml;base64,anything'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_malicious_scheme_javascript(self):
        # Test javascript scheme returns True
        url = 'javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_malicious_scheme_vbscript(self):
        # Test vbscript scheme returns True
        url = 'vbscript:msgbox("hello")'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_malicious_scheme_data_non_image(self):
        # Test non-image data URL returns True
        url = 'data:text/html;base64,<script>alert(1)</script>'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_safe_non_image_url(self):
        # Test safe non-image URL returns False
        url = 'http://example.com'
        self.assertFalse(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_image_dataurl_safe_with_malicious_scheme_after(self):
        # Test safe image data URL followed by malicious scheme returns False
        url = 'data:image/png;base64,... javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertFalse(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_image_dataurl_unsafe_with_malicious_scheme_after(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL followed by malicious scheme returns True
        url = 'data:image/svg+xml;base64,... javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_malicious_scheme_in_middle(self):
        # Test malicious scheme in middle of string returns True
        url = 'abcjavascript:def'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_safe_image_dataurl_not_at_beginning(self):
        # Test safe image data URL not at beginning returns True
        url = 'abcdata:image/png;base64,...'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test non-string input raises TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            is_malicious_scheme(None)

    def test_malicious_scheme_uppercase(self):
        # Test uppercase malicious scheme returns True
        url = 'JAVASCRIPT:ALERT(1)'
        self.assertTrue(is_malicious_scheme(url))

import unittest

class TestVerifyJavascriptProtocol(unittest.TestCase):

    def test_case_1(self):
        # Test empty string
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol(''))

    def test_case_2(self):
        # Test harmless non-data URL
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol('http://example.com'))

    def test_case_3(self):
        # Test javascript URL
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol('javascript:alert(1)'))

    def test_case_4(self):
        # Test vbscript URL
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol('vbscript:msgbox(\'hello\')'))

    def test_case_5(self):
        # Test safe image data URL (png)
        url = 'data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=='
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_6(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (svg)
        url = 'data:image/svg;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg=='
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_7(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (xml)
        url = 'data:image/xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg=='
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_8(self):
        # Test non-image data URL (text)
        url = 'data:text/plain;base64,SGVsbG8sIFdvcmxkIQ=='
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_9(self):
        # Test safe image data URL in the beginning and malicious scheme later
        url = 'data:image/png;base64,... javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_10(self):
        # Test malicious scheme then safe image data URL
        url = 'javascript:alert(1) data:image/png;base64,...'
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_11(self):
        # Test image data URL with mixed case (safe)
        url = 'DATA:ImAgE/pNg;base64,...'
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_12(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL with mixed case
        url = 'dAtA:ImAgE/sVg;base64,...'
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_13(self):
        # Test string with harmless scheme and malicious scheme in the middle
        url = 'Visit my site: javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_14(self):
        # Test string with harmless scheme and malicious scheme at the end
        url = 'This is a test: javascript:alert(1)'
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol(url))

    def test_case_15(self):
        # Test about:blank
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol('about:blank'))

    def test_case_16(self):
        # Test malicious scheme without colon -> should not match
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol('javascript alert(1)'))

    def test_case_17(self):
        # Test harmless colon
        self.assertFalse(verify_javascript_protocol('abc:def'))

    def test_case_18(self):
        # Test malicious scheme as part of a word
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol('abcjavascript:alert(1)'))

    def test_case_19(self):
        # Test mocha scheme
        self.assertTrue(verify_javascript_protocol('mocha:test'))

    def test_case_20(self):
        # Test None input -> expect an exception (TypeError)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            verify_javascript_protocol(None)

    def test_case_21(self):
        # Test non-string input (integer) -> expect an exception (TypeError)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            verify_javascript_protocol(123)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import re

class TestCases(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_safe_image_data_url(self):
        # Test safe image data URL (png) returns False
        url = "data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="
        self.assertFalse(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_unsafe_image_data_url_svg(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (svg) returns True
        url = "data:image/svg;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg=="
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_unsafe_image_data_url_svg_xml(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL (svg+xml) returns True
        url = "data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMj000MC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg=="
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_non_image_data_url(self):
        # Test non-image data URL returns True (due to 'data:' scheme)
        url = "data:text/html;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg=="
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_javascript_scheme(self):
        # Test 'javascript:' scheme returns True
        url = "javascript:alert('xss')"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_vbscript_scheme_in_middle(self):
        # Test 'vbscript:' in middle returns True
        url = "Hello vbscript:alert('xss') world"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_mixed_case_scheme(self):
        # Test malicious scheme with mixed case returns True
        url = "JAVASCRIPT:alert('xss')"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_safe_scheme_http(self):
        # Test safe 'http' scheme returns False
        url = "http://example.com"
        self.assertFalse(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_no_scheme(self):
        # Test string without scheme returns False
        url = "This is a test string"
        self.assertFalse(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string returns False
        self.assertFalse(detect_malicious_url_scheme(""))
    
    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test None input raises TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            detect_malicious_url_scheme(None)
    
    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test integer input raises TypeError
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            detect_malicious_url_scheme(123)
    
    def test_image_url_not_at_start(self):
        # Test image data URL not at start returns True (due to 'data:')
        url = "prefix data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAUAAAAFCAYAAACNbyblAAAAHElEQVQI12P4//8/w38GIAXDIBKE0DHxgljNBAAO9TXL0Y4OHwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_image_url_without_base64(self):
        # Test image data URL without base64 returns True (due to 'data:')
        url = "data:image/png,abc"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_safe_image_with_extra_text(self):
        # Test safe image data URL with extra text returns False
        url = "data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4AAQSkZJRgABAQEASABKdhH//2Q== extra text"
        self.assertFalse(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_unsafe_image_with_extra_text(self):
        # Test unsafe image data URL with extra text returns True
        url = "data:image/svg;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg== extra text"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_about_scheme(self):
        # Test 'about:' scheme returns True
        url = "about:blank"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_mocha_scheme(self):
        # Test 'mocha:' scheme returns True
        url = "mocha:test"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))
    
    def test_livescript_scheme(self):
        # Test 'livescript:' scheme returns True
        url = "livescript:alert('test')"
        self.assertTrue(detect_malicious_url_scheme(url))

import unittest
from unittest.mock import patch
from command_module import validate_and_execute_command

@patch('command_module.ALLOWED_COMMANDS', ['ls', 'echo', 'pwd'])
class TestCommandValidation(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_allowed_commands(self):
        # Test each allowed command returns itself
        for cmd in ['ls', 'echo', 'pwd']:
            with self.subTest(cmd=cmd):
                result = validate_and_execute_command(cmd)
                self.assertEqual(result, cmd)
    
    def test_not_allowed_command(self):
        # Test command not in allowed list returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command('cat')
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty string returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command('')
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_case_sensitivity(self):
        # Test case sensitivity (uppercase not allowed)
        result = validate_and_execute_command('LS')
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_non_string_input(self):
        # Test non-string input returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command(123)
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_substring_of_command(self):
        # Test substring of allowed command returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command('ech')
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_superset_command(self):
        # Test command with extra characters returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command('echo hello')
        self.assertIsNone(result)
    
    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test very long non-allowed command returns None
        long_str = 'a' * 1000
        result = validate_and_execute_command(long_str)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_whitespace_command(self):
        # Test command with leading/trailing whitespace returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command(' ls ')
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_special_characters(self):
        # Test command with special characters returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command('echo $HOME')
        self.assertIsNone(result)

    def test_null_input(self):
        # Test None input returns None
        result = validate_and_execute_command(None)
        self.assertIsNone(result)

import unittest

class TestAddCustomHeader(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_normal_string(self):
        # Test with normal string without special characters
        header_value = 'HelloWorld'
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: HelloWorld')

    def test_newline_removal(self):
        # Test removal of newline characters
        header_value = 'Hello\nWorld'
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: HelloWorld')

    def test_carriage_return_removal(self):
        # Test removal of carriage return characters
        header_value = 'Hello\rWorld'
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: HelloWorld')

    def test_mixed_newline_carriage_return(self):
        # Test removal of mixed newline and carriage return
        header_value = 'Header\r\nValue\nTest'
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: HeaderValueTest')

    def test_empty_string(self):
        # Test empty header value
        header_value = ''
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: ')

    def test_long_string(self):
        # Test long string without special characters
        header_value = 'A' * 10000
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: ' + 'A'*10000)

    def test_non_ascii_with_newline(self):
        # Test non-ASCII characters with newline
        header_value = 'H\xe9ll\xf6\nW\xf6rld'
        result = add_custom_header(header_value)
        self.assertEqual(result, 'Custom-Header: H\xe9ll\xf6W\xf6rld')

    def test_none_input(self):
        # Test None input (invalid type)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            add_custom_header(None)

    def test_integer_input(self):
        # Test integer input (invalid type)
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            add_custom_header(123)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()

import unittest
import html

# Define the global html_template that the function uses
html_template = "<html><body>{user_content}</body></html>"

class TestGenerateHtmlResponse(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_normal_string(self):
        """Test a normal string without special characters"""
        input_str = "Hello, World!"
        expected = "<html><body>Hello, World!</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_html_tags(self):
        """Test a string containing HTML tags"""
        input_str = "<script>alert('xss')</script>"
        expected = "<html><body><script>alert('xss')</script></body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_ampersand(self):
        """Test a string with an ampersand"""
        input_str = "A & B"
        expected = "<html><body>A & B</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_double_quotes(self):
        """Test a string with double quotes"""
        input_str = 'He said, "Hello"'
        expected = "<html><body>He said, "Hello"</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_single_quotes(self):
        """Test a string with single quotes"""
        input_str = "It's a beautiful day"
        expected = "<html><body>It's a beautiful day</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_empty_string(self):
        """Test an empty string"""
        input_str = ""
        expected = "<html><body></body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_non_string_input(self):
        """Test non-string input (should raise TypeError)"""
        with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
            generate_html_response(123)

    def test_long_string(self):
        """Test a very long string"""
        input_str = "A" * 10000
        expected = f"<html><body>{input_str}</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

    def test_special_characters(self):
        """Test a string with multiple special characters"""
        input_str = '<>&"\''
        expected = "<html><body><>&"'</body></html>"
        result = generate_html_response(input_str)
        self.assertEqual(result, expected)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()
